model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: How did the exam go?
Speaker B: Well, I have a few coming up. It's almost finals season. I'm still studying for them but I think it'll be ok. How about your history exam?
Speaker A: The history exam went pretty well, I got a B. I think that if I would have studied more, I would have got an A.
Speaker B: A B is still pretty great though! Do you have more exams coming up or are you on a break now? 

MEMORY 1:
1. Speaker B is on their way to college and studying sports medicine, which is causing them to get all A's in the sports medicine class. This pressure stems from the need to maintain straight A's to avoid embarrassing their mother who runs the school.
   
2. Speaker B has sports medicine training and is taking an exam in that subject, leading them to feel pressured to maintain straight A's to avoid embarrassing their mother who runs the school.
   
3. Speaker B is on their way to college and studying sports medicine, while Speaker A struggles with history class and finds it boring. Both are dealing with different academic pressures and feelings of being overwhelmed.

MEMORY 2:

Maybe you can make it out to one of my games sometime? ### Speaker B: I would love that. Hopefully I can make it this weekend. I wish my teacher was better, or at least made the topic interesting.  It's so boring in his class that I have a hard time paying attention. ### Speaker B: It is for my sport medicine. It is the last one of the class I have made A's all year so hopefully I can pass this one also and I'll be done. ### Speaker A: Oh nice!  I wish that I could get all A's.  I'm more of a B and occasional C student.  The only guaranteed A I have is in gym, haha ### Speaker B: I think everyone gets an A in gym. I have studied really hard to get those As I want to pass with good grades. I figure it would help me get a good job afterwards. ### Speaker A: I'm sure it will.  My sister got good grades in school and ended up with a great teaching job.  I know it's not the same, but it definitely helped her.  I still am hoping that I can get a soccer scholarship, because there's no way that I'll get one for my academics. ### Speaker B: Just keep at it and try your hardest. You never know you might surprise yourself' }
